alert_warn_detail: Ideal > 100. This usually indicates poor cell handling, poor library quality, or poor sequencing quality. Application performance is likely to be affected.
alert_warn_detail_cs: Estimated number of cells is expected to be > 100. This usually indicates poor cell handling, poor library quality, or poor sequencing quality. Application performance is likely to be affected.
alert_warn_name: Low Number of Cells Detected
help_description: The number of barcodes associated with at least one cell.

alert_warn_detail: The analyzed library is a Chromium Single Cell Multiome ATAC + Gene Expression library that should be analyzed using the cellranger-arc pipeline. Please download the cellranger-arc pipeline from https://support.10xgenomics.com.
alert_warn_name: ARC Chemistry Detected

alert_warn_detail: High throughput (HT) chemistry was specified, but Cell Ranger detected that data was not HT. This may be due to low sequencing depth, sample quality issues, or incorrect chemistry input to Cell Ranger. If applicable, cell multiplexing results may not be accurate.
alert_warn_name: Inconsistent Throughput Detected

help_description: The total number of sequenced reads divided by the number of barcodes associated with cell-containing partitions.
The median number of genes detected per cell-associated barcode. Detection is defined as the presence of at least 1 UMI count.
Total number of read pairs that were assigned to this library in demultiplexing.
Total number of read pairs that were ignored by the pipeline because they do not satisfy the minimum length requirements (for example read1 less that 26 bases in 3' v2 or 3' v3 or 5').

alert_warn_detail: Ideal > 75%. This may indicate a quality issue with the Illumina I7 read for Single Cell 3' v1 or the R1 read for Single Cell 3' v2/v3 and Single Cell 5'. Application performance may be affected.
alert_warn_name: Low Fraction Valid Barcodes
help_description: Fraction of reads with barcodes that match the whitelist after barcode correction.

alert_warn_detail: Ideal > 75%. This may indicate a quality issue with the Illumina R2 read for Single Cell 3' v1 or the R1 read for Single Cell 3' v2/v3 and Single Cell 5'. Application performance may be affected.
alert_warn_name: Low Fraction Valid UMIs
help_description: Fraction of reads with valid UMIs; i.e. UMI sequences that do not contain Ns and that are not homopolymers.
The total number of sequenced reads divided by the number of barcodes associated with cell-containing partitions.

The fraction of reads originating from an already-observed UMI. This is a function of library complexity and sequencing depth. More specifically, this is the fraction of confidently mapped, valid cell-barcode, valid UMI reads that had a non-unique (cell-barcode, UMI, gene). This metric was called 'cDNA PCR Duplication' in versions of Cell Ranger prior to 1.2.

alert_warn_detail: Fraction of cell barcode bases (Illumina I7 Read for Single Cell 3' v1, R1 for Single Cell 3' v2/v3 and Single Cell 5') with Q-score >= 30 should be above 55%. A lower fraction might indicate poor sequencing quality.
alert_warn_name: Fraction of cell barcode bases with Q-score >= 30 is low
help_description: Fraction of cell barcode bases with Q-score >= 30, excluding very low quality/no-call (Q <= 2) bases from the denominator.

alert_warn_detail: Fraction of RNA read bases with Q-score >= 30 should be above 65%. A lower fraction might indicate poor sequencing quality. This is Read 1 for the Single Cell 3' v1 chemistry and Single Cell 5' paired end, Read 2 for the Single Cell 3' v2/v3 chemistry and Single Cell 5' R2-only)
alert_warn_name: Fraction of RNA read bases with Q-score >= 30 is low
help_description: Fraction of RNA read bases with Q-score >= 30, excluding very low quality/no-call (Q <= 2) bases from the denominator. This is Read 1 for the Single Cell 3' v1 chemistry and Single Cell 5' paired end, Read 2 for the Single Cell 3' v2/v3 chemistry and Single Cell 5' R2-only).
Fraction of RNA read 2 bases with Q-score >= 30, excluding very low quality/no-call (Q <= 2) bases from the denominator.

alert_warn_detail: Fraction of UMI bases (Illumina R2 Read for Single Cell 3' v1, R1 for Single Cell 3' v2/v3 and Single Cell 5') with Q-score >= 30 should be above 75%. A lower fraction might indicate poor sequencing quality.
alert_warn_name: Fraction of UMI bases with Q-score >= 30 is low
help_description: Fraction of UMI bases with Q-score >= 30, excluding very low quality/no-call (Q <= 2) bases from the denominator.

alert_warn_detail: Ideal > 100. This usually indicates poor cell handling, poor library quality, or poor sequencing quality. Application performance is likely to be affected.
alert_warn_detail_cs: Estimated number of cells is expected to be > 100. This usually indicates poor cell handling, poor library quality, or poor sequencing quality. Application performance is likely to be affected.
alert_warn_name: Low Number of Cells Detected
help_description: The number of barcodes associated with at least one cell.
The total number of sequenced reads divided by the number of barcodes associated with cell-containing partitions.
Total number of CRISPR library reads.
Total number of CRISPR library read pairs that were ignored by the pipeline because they do not satisfy the minimum length requirements (for example read1 less that 26 bases in 3' v2 or 3' v3 or 5').
The total number of sequenced CRISPR library reads divided by the number of barcodes associated with cell-containing partitions.
Fraction of CRISPR library reads with a barcode found in or corrected to one that is found in the whitelist.
Fraction of CRISPR library reads with valid UMIs.

The fraction of CRISPR library reads originating from an already-observed UMI. This is a function of library complexity and sequencing depth. More specifically, this is the fraction of confidently mapped, valid cell-barcode, valid UMI reads that had a non-unique (cell-barcode, UMI, CRISPR feature barcode).
Fraction of CRISPR library cell barcode bases with Q-score >= 30, excluding very low quality/no-call (Q <= 2) bases from the denominator.

Fraction of CRISPR library read bases with Q-score >= 30, excluding very low quality/no-call (Q <= 2) bases from the denominator. This is Read 2 for the Single Cell 3' v3 and Single Cell 5' chemistries.
Fraction of CRISPR library read 2 bases with Q-score >= 30, excluding very low quality/no-call (Q <= 2) bases from the denominator.
Fraction of CRISPR library UMI bases with Q-score >= 30, excluding very low quality/no-call (Q <= 2) bases from the denominator.
Total number of Antibody library reads.
Total number of Antibody library reads that were ignored by the pipeline because they do not satisfy the minimum length requirements (for example read1 less that 26 bases in 3' v2 or 3' v3 or 5').
The total number of sequenced Antibody library reads divided by the number of barcodes associated with cell-containing partitions.
Fraction of Antibody library reads with a barcode found in or corrected to one that is found in the whitelist.
Fraction of Antibody library reads with valid UMIs.

The fraction of Antibody library reads originating from an already-observed UMI. This is a function of library complexity and sequencing depth. More specifically, this is the fraction of confidently mapped, valid cell-barcode, valid UMI reads that had a non-unique (cell-barcode, UMI, Antibody feature barcode).
Fraction of Antibody library cell barcode bases with Q-score >= 30, excluding very low quality/no-call (Q <= 2) bases from the denominator.

Fraction of Antibody library read bases with Q-score >= 30, excluding very low quality/no-call (Q <= 2) bases from the denominator. This is Read 2 for the Single Cell 3' v3 and Single Cell 5' chemistries.
Fraction of Antibody library read 2 bases with Q-score >= 30, excluding very low quality/no-call (Q <= 2) bases from the denominator.
Fraction of Antibody library UMI bases with Q-score >= 30, excluding very low quality/no-call (Q <= 2) bases from the denominator.
Total number of Antigen library reads.
Total number of Antigen library reads that were ignored by the pipeline because they do not satisfy the minimum length requirements (for example read1 less that 26 bases in 3' v2 or 3' v3 or 5').
The total number of sequenced Antigen library reads divided by the number of barcodes associated with cell-containing partitions.
Fraction of Antigen library reads with a barcode found in or corrected to one that is found in the whitelist.
Fraction of Antigen library reads with valid UMIs.

The fraction of Antigen library reads originating from an already-observed UMI. This is a function of library complexity and sequencing depth. More specifically, this is the fraction of confidently mapped, valid cell-barcode, valid UMI reads that had a non-unique (cell-barcode, UMI, Antigen feature barcode).
Fraction of Antigen library cell barcode bases with Q-score >= 30, excluding very low quality/no-call (Q <= 2) bases from the denominator.

Fraction of Antigen library read bases with Q-score >= 30, excluding very low quality/no-call (Q <= 2) bases from the denominator. This is Read 2 for the Single Cell 3' v3 and Single Cell 5' chemistries.
Fraction of Antigen library read 2 bases with Q-score >= 30, excluding very low quality/no-call (Q <= 2) bases from the denominator.
Fraction of Antigen library UMI bases with Q-score >= 30, excluding very low quality/no-call (Q <= 2) bases from the denominator.
Total number of Custom library reads.
Total number of Custom library reads that were ignored by the pipeline because they do not satisfy the minimum length requirements (for example read1 less that 26 bases in 3' v2 or 3' v3 or 5').
The total number of sequenced Custom library reads divided by the number of barcodes associated with cell-containing partitions.
Fraction of Custom library reads with a barcode found in or corrected to one that is found in the whitelist.
Fraction of Custom library reads with valid UMIs.

The fraction of Custom library reads originating from an already-observed UMI. This is a function of library complexity and sequencing depth. More specifically, this is the fraction of confidently mapped, valid cell-barcode, valid UMI reads that had a non-unique (cell-barcode, UMI, Custom feature barcode).
Fraction of Custom library cell barcode bases with Q-score >= 30, excluding very low quality/no-call (Q <= 2) bases from the denominator.

Fraction of Custom library read bases with Q-score >= 30, excluding very low quality/no-call (Q <= 2) bases from the denominator. This is Read 2 for the Single Cell 3' v3 and Single Cell 5' chemistries.
Fraction of Custom library read 2 bases with Q-score >= 30, excluding very low quality/no-call (Q <= 2) bases from the denominator.
Fraction of Custom library UMI bases with Q-score >= 30, excluding very low quality/no-call (Q <= 2) bases from the denominator.
Fraction of reads that mapped to the genome.
Fraction of reads that mapped uniquely to the genome. If a gene mapped to exonic loci from a single gene and also to non-exonic loci, it is considered uniquely mapped to one of the exonic loci.

full_name: Reads Mapped Confidently to Intergenic Regions
help_description: Fraction of reads that mapped uniquely to an intergenic region of the genome.

full_name: Reads Mapped Confidently to Intronic Regions
help_description: Fraction of reads that mapped uniquely to an intronic region of the genome.

full_name: Reads Mapped Confidently to Exonic Regions
help_description: Fraction of reads that mapped uniquely to an exonic region of the genome.

alert_warn_detail: Ideal > 30%. This can indicate use of the wrong reference transcriptome, a reference transcriptome with overlapping genes, poor library quality, poor sequencing quality, or reads shorter than the recommended minimum. Application performance may be affected.
alert_warn_name: Low Fraction Reads Confidently Mapped To Transcriptome
help_description: Fraction of reads that mapped to a unique gene in the transcriptome. The read must be consistent with annotated splice junctions when include-introns=false. These reads are considered for UMI counting.

alert_warn_detail: Ideal < 20%. This can indicate low RNA content in the sample, poor washing after probe hybridization, deviation from recommended protocol during probe hybridization, or suboptimal sample preparation.
alert_warn_name: High Fraction Reads Half-Mapped to Probe Set
help_description: Fraction of reads that mapped to unpaired ligation products.

alert_warn_detail: Ideal < 20%. This can indicate low RNA content in the sample, poor washing after probe hybridization, deviation from recommended protocol during probe hybridization, or suboptimal sample preparation.
alert_warn_name: High Fraction Reads Split-Mapped to Probe Set
help_description: Fraction of reads that mapped to mispaired ligation products.

The fraction of targeted reads originating from an already-observed targeted UMI. This is a function of library complexity and sequencing depth. More specifically, this is the fraction of confidently mapped, valid cell-barcode, valid targeted UMI reads that had a non-unique (cell-barcode, UMI, gene). This metric was called 'cDNA PCR Duplication' in versions of Cell Ranger prior to 1.2.
The total number of targeted reads divided by the number of barcodes associated with cell-containing partitions.
The median number of targeted genes detected per cell-associated barcode. Detection is defined as the presence of at least 1 UMI count.
The number of targeted genes with at least one UMI count in any cell.

full_name: Median Targeted UMI Counts per Cell
help_description: The median number of targeted UMI counts per cell-associated barcode.

full_name: Reads Mapped Confidently to the Transcriptome
help_description: Fraction of reads that mapped to a unique targeted gene in the transcriptome. The read must be consistent with annotated splice junctions. These reads are considered for UMI counting.

full_name: Reads Mapped Confidently to the Transcriptome
help_description: Fraction of reads that mapped to a unique gene in the transcriptome. The read must be consistent with annotated splice junctions. These reads are considered for UMI counting. This fraction is computed separately for targeted and non-targeted gene categories.

full_name: Fraction of Reads Removed by UMI Filtering
help_description: Fraction of all reads confidently mapped to the targeted transcriptome and subsequently removed by targeted UMI filtering.

full_name: Reads per UMI threshold for UMI filtering
help_description: Minimum number of reads per UMI required to pass UMI filtering. UMIs in targeted genes with read support (strictly) lower than this threshold are filtered out. UMI filtering is not applied to non-targeted genes.

Number of genes per category. The number of targeted genes is specified via the target panel file. The number of non-targeted genes is the difference between the total number of genes in the reference and the number of targeted genes.

Number of genes per category. The number of targeted genes is specified via the target panel file. The number of non-targeted genes is the difference between the total number of genes in the reference and the number of targeted genes.
Number of genes with at least 10 filtered UMIs from cell-associated barcodes. These genes are used to calculate per-gene enrichments.
Number of genes with at least 10 filtered UMIs from cell-associated barcodes. These genes are used to calculate per-gene enrichments.

Number of enriched genes per category. Genes are classified with a two-class Gaussian mixture model into two groups based on the mean reads per UMI value for each gene. Enriched genes have higher mean reads per UMI values, indicating their over-representation in the targeted library.

Number of enriched genes per category. Genes are classified with a two-class Gaussian mixture model into two groups based on the mean reads per UMI value for each gene. Enriched genes have higher mean reads per UMI values, indicating their over-representation in the targeted library.

full_name: Mean Reads per UMI per Gene
help_description: Mean number of reads per UMI for each gene, averaged across genes. Only genes with >= 10 filtered UMIs from cell-associated barcodes are considered.

full_name: Mean Reads per UMI per Gene
help_description: Mean number of reads per UMI for each gene, averaged across genes. Only genes with >= 10 filtered UMIs from cell-associated barcodes are considered.

alert_warn_detail: Ideal > 70%. This can indicate use of the wrong target panel or inefficient targeting. Targeted performance may be affected.
alert_warn_name: Low Fraction of Targeted Genes Enriched
help_description: Fraction of Targeted Genes with >= 10 cell-associated UMIs that are enriched.

full_name: High Fraction of Non-Targeted Genes Enriched
alert_warn_detail: This can indicate use of the wrong target panel or inefficient targeting. Targeted performance may be affected.
alert_warn_name: High Fraction of Enriched Genes are Non-Targeted
help_description: High Fraction of Non-Targeted Genes Enriched.

alert_warn_detail: Ideal < 10% for single cell samples. High antisense mapping rate can indicate use of an incorrect chemistry type, an issue with the reference transcriptome, or elevated levels of antisense reads. Application performance is likely to be affected.
alert_warn_name: High Fraction of Reads Mapped Antisense to Genes
help_description: Fraction of reads confidently mapped to the transcriptome, but on the opposite strand of their annotated gene. A read is counted as antisense if it has any alignments that are consistent with an exon of a transcript but antisense to it, and has no sense alignments.

alert_warn_detail: Ideal > 100. This usually indicates poor cell handling, poor library quality, or poor sequencing quality. Application performance is likely to be affected.
alert_warn_detail_cs: Estimated number of cells is expected to be > 100.  This usually indicates poor cell handling, poor library quality, or poor sequencing quality. Application performance is likely to be affected.
alert_warn_name: Low Number of Cells Detected
help_description: The number of barcodes associated with at least one cell.

alert_warn_detail: Ideal > 70%. Application performance may be affected. Many of the reads were not assigned to cell-associated barcodes. This could be caused by high levels of ambient RNA or by a significant population of cells with a low RNA content, which the algorithm did not call as cells. The latter case can be addressed by inspecting the data to determine the appropriate cell count and using --force-cells.
alert_warn_name: Low Fraction Reads in Cells
help_description: The fraction of valid-barcode, confidently-mapped reads with cell-associated barcodes.
The number of genes with at least one UMI count in any cell.
The median number of UMI counts per %s cell-associated barcode.
The number of barcodes associated with at least one cell.
The inferred number of barcodes that are associated with multiple cells.
The mean fraction of cell-associated barcodes estimated to be associated with more than one cell, calculated via bootstrap sampling and adjusting for the ratio of the two cell types.

full_name: Fraction Reads with Putative Protospacer Sequence
help_description: Fraction of feature barcoding library reads from which a putative protospacer sequence could be extracted.
Fraction of CRISPR library reads with a recognized protospacer sequence.
Fraction of CRISPR library reads with a recognized protospacer sequence, a valid UMI, and a cell-associated barcode.
Number of CRISPR library guide reads usable divided by the number of cell-associated barcodes.
Among all CRISPR library reads with a putative protospacer sequence, the fraction with a protospacer sequence that was not recognized.
Among CRISPR library reads with a recognized protospacer sequence, a valid UMI, and a valid barcode, the fraction associated with cell-containing partitions.

full_name: Cells with 1 or more protospacers detected
help_description: Cells with 1 or more protospacers detected.

full_name: Cells with 2 or more protospacers detected
help_description: Cells with 2 or more protospacers detected.
Median UMIs per Cell (summed over all recognized protospacers).
Fraction of Antibody library reads that contain a recognized antibody barcode.
Fraction of Antibody library reads that contain a recognized antibody barcode, a valid UMI, and a cell-associated barcode.
Number of Antibody library reads usable divided by the number of cell-associated barcodes.

full_name: Fraction Antibody Reads in Aggregate Barcodes
alert_warn_detail: Ideal < 5%. Detected some aggregate barcodes. These barcodes and their corresponding reads have been removed from the final matrix.
alert_warn_name: High Fraction of Antibody Reads in Aggregate Barcodes
help_description: Fraction of Antibody library reads that was lost after removing aggregate barcodes.
Among all Antibody library reads, the fraction with an unrecognizable antibody barcode.
Among Antibody library reads with a recognized antibody barcode, a valid UMI, and a valid barcode, the fraction associated with cell-containing partitions.

full_name: Median UMIs per Cell (summed over all recognized antibody barcodes)
help_description: Median UMIs per Cell (summed over all recognized antibody barcodes).
Fraction of Antigen library reads that contain a recognized antigen barcode.
Fraction of Antigen library reads that contain a recognized antigen barcode, a valid UMI, and a cell-associated barcode.
Number of Antigen library reads usable divided by the number of cell-associated barcodes.

full_name: Fraction Antigen Reads in Aggregate Barcodes
alert_warn_detail: Ideal < 5%. Detected some aggregate barcodes. These barcodes and their corresponding reads have been removed from the final matrix.
alert_warn_name: High Fraction of Antigen Reads in Aggregate Barcodes
help_description: Fraction of Antigen library reads that was lost after removing aggregate barcodes.
Among all Antigen library reads, the fraction with an unrecognizable antigen barcode.
Among Antigen library reads with a recognized antigen barcode, a valid UMI, and a valid barcode, the fraction associated with cell-containing partitions.

full_name: Median UMIs per Cell (summed over all recognized antigen barcodes)
help_description: Median UMIs per Cell (summed over all recognized antigen barcodes).
Fraction of Custom library reads that contain a recognized feature barcode.
Fraction of Custom library reads that contain a recognized feature barcode, a valid UMI, and a cell-associated barcode.
Number of Feature library reads usable divided by the number of cell-associated barcodes.
Among all Feature library reads, the fraction with an unrecognizable antibody barcode.
Among Feature library reads with a recognized antibody barcode, a valid UMI, and a valid barcode, the fraction associated with cell-containing partitions.

full_name: Median UMIs per Cell (summed over all recognized feature barcodes)
help_description: Median UMIs per Cell (summed over all recognized feature barcodes).
Total number of read pairs that were assigned to these libraries in demultiplexing.
Number of read pairs after normalizing for depth among multiple libraries.
The fraction of reads kept for this input sample, after normalizing depth across samples to reduce batch effects.
The mean number of total sequencing reads per cell in this input sample, prior to depth normalization.

full_name: Pre-Normalization Confidently Mapped Barcoded Reads per Cell
help_description: The mean number of confidently-mapped, valid-barcode reads per cell in this input sample, prior to depth normalization.

full_name: Pre-Normalization Confidently Mapped Barcoded Targeted Reads per Cell
help_description: The mean number of confidently-mapped-to-targeted-transcriptome, valid-barcode reads per cell in this input sample, prior to depth normalization. Reads are considered mapped to the targeted transcriptome if they are aligned to a targeted gene.

alert_warn_detail: Ideal > 50%. There may be large differences in sequencing depth across the input libraries. Application performance may be affected.
alert_warn_name: Low Post-Normalization Read Depth
help_description: The fraction of reads kept for this input sample, after normalizing depth across samples to reduce batch effects.
The total number of sequenced reads divided by the number of barcodes associated with cell-containing partitions.
The total number of (depth-normalized) reads divided by the number of barcodes associated with cell-containing partitions.
The fraction of reads kept for this input sample, after normalizing depth across samples to reduce batch effects.
The mean number of total sequencing reads per cell in this input sample, prior to depth normalization.

full_name: Pre-Normalization Confidently Mapped Barcoded Reads per Cell
help_description: The mean number of confidently-mapped, valid-barcode reads per cell in this input sample, prior to depth normalization.
The fraction of reads kept for this input sample, after normalizing depth across samples to reduce batch effects.
The mean number of total sequencing reads per cell in this input sample, prior to depth normalization.

full_name: Pre-Normalization Confidently Mapped Barcoded Reads per Cell
help_description: The mean number of confidently-mapped, valid-barcode reads per cell in this input sample, prior to depth normalization.
The fraction of reads kept for this input sample, after normalizing depth across samples to reduce batch effects.
The mean number of total sequencing reads per cell in this input sample, prior to depth normalization.

full_name: Pre-Normalization Confidently Mapped Barcoded Reads per Cell
help_description: The mean number of confidently-mapped, valid-barcode reads per cell in this input sample, prior to depth normalization.
The fraction of reads kept for this input sample, after normalizing depth across samples to reduce batch effects.
The mean number of total sequencing reads per cell in this input sample, prior to depth normalization.

full_name: Pre-Normalization Confidently Mapped Barcoded Reads per Cell
help_description: The mean number of confidently-mapped, valid-barcode reads per cell in this input sample, prior to depth normalization.
Before chemistry batch correction, the average fraction of 100 nearest neighbors belonging to the same batch, normalized by the expected value without batch effect.
After chemistry batch correction, the average fraction of 100 nearest neighbors belonging to the same batch, normalized by the expected value without batch effect.

full_name: Reads Mapped Confidently to the Targeted Transcriptome
alert_warn_detail: Ideal > 30%. This can indicate use of a small panel with low aggregate expression, use of the wrong target panel, or inefficient targeting. Targeted performance may be affected.
alert_warn_name: Low Fraction Reads Confidently Mapped To Targeted Transcriptome
help_description: Fraction of reads that mapped to a unique targeted gene in the transcriptome. The read must be consistent with annotated splice junctions. These reads are considered for UMI counting.
